Name: Kargo
Description: Kargo or Card Golf is a game of golf played with cards. No knowledge of golf is necessary in order to play. A pack   of 53 playing cards and an instruction booklet are included. Play of the cards determines what happens to you out on the course.

Name: Bellhop
Description:
Bellhop is a strategy game where players play as competing shift managers in a hotel. The year is 1939, in New York; the guests in the hotel are leaving for the World's Fair. Each player controls a team of bellhops in the hotel and attempts to earn the most tips by helping the guests off of the elevator and with their luggage as they arrive in the lobby.

You can backstab your friends' bellhops and reduce his/her tips by stopping their elevator. Be careful, though, as you might not be able to get your guests to the lobby without help! The player who has received the most tips at the end of the game wins. Maximize your points by collecting guests of all types. Try to get a bonus by helping the most guests of any one type.

Bellhop plays with 2-5 players and lasts between 45 and 60 minutes. The photos are of an unpublished prototype and the designer is actively looking for a publisher.

Name: Kaskade
Description: Nice little 'Stacking Game' by a small game company that specialized in 'wooden games'. Game consists of 48 round wooden sticks and a die. Beginning of the game all wooden pieces lie next to each other flat on the table. On his turn a player has to roll the die and put the rolled number of wooden pieces from either end on top of the others. If this causes some sticks to "roll away" etc. the player collects one penalty stick that scores negative points according to its color. Once a player reaches a certain number of points the player with the lowest score wins.

Name: Wilderness Wars
Description: Wilderness Wars simulates company and battalion-sized conflicts during the 18th century - specifically the French and Indian War, American Revolutionary War and War of 1812.

Name: Fast Trak
Description:
The Exciting Game of Racing

On a player's turn, they roll the dice and move their own car the full amount on one of the dice, and move one of their opponent's car the full amount on the other die.

Be the first player to cross the finish line on the final lap and win the race.

Name: Americana
Description: Americana is a game of chance, played upon a board. Chips or counters and an ordinary pack of playing cards are essential to the game. By obtaining certain cards or combinations of cards (based upon traditional poker hands), the players try to obtain for themselves the greatest possible number of chips from the spaces on the board where they are placed at the start or during the play of each hand.

Name: Missoula-opoly
Description:
Missoula-opoly is another variant of the real estate acquiring game, Monopoly. Instead of buying properties in Atlantic City, players of Missoula-opoly compete to buy properties and businesses in Missoula, Montana.

The game was originally created as a fund raiser for Missoula Strings on Tour. The center of the board features artwork by Monte Dolack.

Name: Scout
Description: The aim is to move your scouts from one side of the board to the other. The board is a transparent plastic case in which you push tiles which make up a 6x8 rectangular maze. Each tile has a different 3x3 arrangement of pathways and hedges. There are 49 tiles and on each turn you push the extra tile into one of the rows (in which you have a pawn) to alter the maze (and push out a tile from the other end). Both before and after you do this you can move any of your scouts towards the far side of the maze.

Name: Plotz!
Description: With a box cover featuring characters from Johnny Hart's comic strip "B.C." this game has players rolling dice and competing to be the first player to place his marble in the correct hole of a grid. The first player to place three marbles of his color in a row wins.

Name: The American Revolution
Description: The American Revolution is just one of the many cult classic games by Guild of Blades. Using the award winning "Empires of History" game engine this game can be played as if you controlled the entires armies under your command.. not just a battle or two. First in the Guild of Blades new "Signature Series" these are good games that play well and are as historically accurate as possible while leaving room for a player to deviate from history. The American Revolution is one of the pivotal points in modern history and the measuring stick for all revolutions to come. In this game you can choose to be the British  or the Americans. Fight the war the way you would have done it from start to end and see if you make the outcome any different.

Name: Bondocones
Description:
The game is played on what is roughly a checker board with 10x12 squares. Each player has 26 cones with a value of either zero (10), 1 (5), 2 (6), 4 (4) or 8 (1) and each turn you can move one cone according to a roll of a die. You try to capture your opponents cones by landing on them, but since the value of each cone is hidden from you opponent you never quite know what you get. The game ends when one player has 28 points.

When moving you can only move in a straight line either horizontally, diagonally or vertically. The exception is one of your cones which has a red ring placed around it - the so called "bondocone." With this you can move in any direction, but may not step on the same square twice. You can capture your opponents "bondo" and thus have two bondocones.

The game is in it's current version also a piece of designer furniture made specific to fit into trendy cafés or as home interior design. The materials are exclusive and really adds to a great gaming experience... Nothing beats a quality game!

Name: Scene it? FIFA Edition
Description: Scene it? -This time with scenes and questions around the Football World cup.

Name: 1870: Grand Tactical Rules for the Franco-Prussian War
Description:
Grand Tactical Rules for the mid-19th century Europe wars of transition

1870 covers the Franco-Prussian War. The rules were designed specifically to accommodate the many large-scale engagements of this important war - from a few divisions to several corps per side.  The intention was to enable gamers to recreate very large battles without getting bogged down in extraneous details more appropriate for regimental-size skirmishes -- indeed, the normal command per player in most games is a corps or two: two to six infantry divisions.  Extensive morale and fire modifiers, multiple movement and fire opportunities, and national or troop type nuances have therefore been kept to a minimum in the interest of finishing a reasonably faithful approximation of a large historical battle in an afternoon.  A half-scale variant of the basic rules enabled smaller engagements to be fought simply by doubling the number of stands per unit in 1870.

Besides the rules, 80 percent of the booklet is devoted to detailed historical notes, background information, orders of battle, and an extensive annotated bibliography which provide ample reference material for custom designing additional campaigns or battles 
Fourteen exhaustively-researched historical battle scenarios are included in the book; these cover both the Imperial and Republican phases of the war. Enabling gamers to accurately recreate the wars' most interesting battles. Each scenario also includes "what if" variants positing historically plausible alternative missions or forces.

The book is extensively illustrated in color throughout, and contain ample diagrams and examples of play, formation diagrams, and game board photographs to help the gamer understanding the nuances of formations, maneuvers, and tactics, as well as visually differentiating the three different playing scales available.

Later expanded by 1859. This book consists of two parts: "1859" and "1864".
"1859" depicts the Second Italian War of Independence between Austria and France/Sardinia. Same scale as "1870", though the 'Double Scale' in 1870 is renamed 'Half Scale' here. 7 scenarios.
"1864" depicts the Second Schleswig War between Denmark and Austria/Prussia. New Quarter Scale is introduced and used in 2 of the 7 scenarios (the remaining scenarios are at Half Scale).

Summary "cheat sheets" are included with both books.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Portfolio
Description:
Portfolio is a board game with simple instructions and a realistic view of the stock market: buy and sell shares, currencies and options. 
A game designed for amateur traders, investor's clubs, and budding financial minds. . . 
A game concept with guaranteed accuracy and quality by stock exchange and financial experts. 
Four levels of difficulty allow players to progressively learn the logic behind trading shares, currencies and options 
Objective of the game:
You are a major player on the stock market. Any decision you make has a significant impact on the current rates. 
Your objective is simple: finish with a bigger fortune than your competitors! 
To do this, you must successfully invest and manage your portfolio given the 20 market situation cards presented throughout the game.
Each of the four levels of difficulty is represented by 20 market situation cards (available in Dutch, French and English) to which all players must react
Do not depend on luck! Only good common sense, strategic thinking and a clear understanding of the various market mechanisms will make the difference.

Name: Schmetterlingsfest
Description:
A butterfly party with tasty fruit-juices is being prepared.  Every player sets a table with the different juices.  The butterflies help.  They are attracted by the colors and the smells of the fruit and will bring the juices to the table.


Ein Schmetterlingsfest mit leckeren Fruchtsäften ist in Vorbereitung. Jeder Spieler soll einen Tisch mit den verschiedenen Säften decken. Die Schmetterlinge helfen dabei. Sie werden von den Farben und dem Duft der Früchte angelockt und bringen die Säfte zu den Tischen.

Name: Exklusiv
Description:
Each player represents a newspaper with an editor and two reporters at their disposal.  With these workers, a player must bring the paper to the top.  In the game, this is represented by a pyramid.  Whomever gets the figure for their paper to the top of the pyramid is the winner.


Jeder Spieler vertritt eine Zeitung und hat dafür einen Redakteur und zwei Reporter zur Verfügung. Mit diesen Mitarbeitern soll er nun Spitzenleistungen erbringen. Im Spiel steht für diese Spitzenleistung eine Pyramide. Wer seine Figuren geschickt einsetzt, kann als erster oben sein.

Name: Exagon
Description:
Two or three players seek to overtake and defend the majority of the board space.  This is easier, the more opposing pieces one can capture.


Zwei oder drei Spieler versuchen die Mehrzahl der Gebiete auf dem Spielplan zu erobern und zu verteidigen. Dies fällt umso leichter, je mehr Gegner man gefangennehmen kann.

Name: Der Methankrieg
Description:
Methankrieg is a board game simulating Perry Rhodan.  The forces of the Maahkas and the Arkondiens fight for the predominance of the milky way.


Der Methankrieg ist ein Brettspiel zur Perry Rhodan Simulation. Die Streitkräfte der Maahks und der Arkoniden kämpfen um die Vorherrschaft der Milchstraße.

Name: Coccinella Lauseschreck
Description:
Players lay their cards in eight garden sections.  When "ecological" connections are made, a player receives points.  The game ends when a player has emptied his or her hand.  Whoever has the most points wins.


Die Spieler legen in den acht Gartenteilen ihre Karten ab. Dabei bemühen sie sich um ökologische Zusammenhänge, denn das bringt Punktgewinne. Das Spiel endet, wenn ein Spieler seine ganzen Karten losgeworden ist. Wer dann die meisten Punkte hat, gewinnt.

Name: Tri-Animals
Description:
This game is designed so that each player starts with six triangular-shaped cards.  Each card, at the tips has a number that must match the card that it is laid down next to, as you strive to empty your hand of cards.  For the 'younger set' there are animals, ranging from sharks to ladybugs, and it, of course, includes dinosaurs.  This way, for kids too young to know their numbers, they can play using the animals as 'the key' to matching their cards.

Each player takes turn matching one card, if no match is possible they must draw cards from the 'tile card pool,' until there is a match, then play continues to the next player.

The game ends when when one of the players runs out of cards.  That person is considered the winner of the game.

Name: Monopoly: Puzz 3D
Description: This is a three dimensional puzzle which when completed forms a monopoly playing board with a raised area in the center of the board with slots for the Chance and Community Chest cards and a box in the Jail space to hold pieces trapped there.  Completing the puzzle also creates a tray to hold the money/Deeds and boxes shaped like the house and hotel pieces to hold the given pieces.  Comes with all regular components for the game (money, houses/hotels, dice, standard monopoly pawns, and deeds) needed to play the game once the puzzle is completed.

Name: Aussie Rules Super Fishin Adventure
Description:
Players learn to recognize several varieties of sea creatures as they explore the sea in search of fish to bring to market. Over 20 different varieties of fish can be caught as players try to bring them to port for sale.

Players can buy new and better ships as they earn money.

Players must remember the locations of the good fishing spots on the modular board in order to win in this easy-to-learn game.

Name: Aussie Rules Super Subsistence Farmer
Description: Players compete to be the first one to make 15 dollars by planting and harvesting over 20 different varieties of crops in this educational card game.

Name: Intervenção na América Latina
Description:
"Intervention in Latin America" is a Brazilian wargame dealing with the US and Soviet influence in Latin America during the Cold War.

More info about the game can be found at:
http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/america.htm

Rules are in Portuguese.

Name: Buckaroo: The Cowboy Roundup Game
Description:
The object of Buckaroo is to maneuver your two Cowboys to corral all your Steers and return them to your ranch before the other player.

Milton Bradley Game No. 4306

Components:

     4 wooden Cowboy pieces
     40 cattle pieces
     2 dice
     Game board
     Rules on inside of box cover

Name: Royal Flush
Description:
Royal Flush is a spielbox game of the early 90s. It's a cross between Perudo (but with cards) and Poker. Instead of rolling pairs you bid with Poker hands.

Originally published in spielbox magazine.

Name: IceFloe
Description:
IceFloe is a piecepack game designed by Tim Schutz.  It was a runner-up for the Changing Landscapes design competition sponsored by Mesomorph Games.

IceFloe uses a piecepack set, piecepack pyramids, and a candle (or another easily accessible incendiary device) for its components.  The game board consists of piecepack tiles that are placed suit-side up; each representing an ice floe.  One player is selected to be the torch bearer and is given the candle.  Game play is broken up into phases.  During the movement phase, starting with the torch bearer, players take turns either moving a game board tile, or moving one of their own pyramids.  After movement, a voting phase takes place, accompanied by a comment period that allows some limited negotiation.  Players vote on which floe is to be blown up by the torch bearer, with the torch bearer being the tie-breaker.  Any pieces on the selected floe are removed from the game.  Often, multiple players will have pieces on a single ice floe, so short term alliances may form during voting.

Complete rules are free to download from http://piecepack.org

Not to be confused with:  Ice Flow

Name: Games to Grow On
Description:
Games to Grow On features two different games from Discovery Toys in one box: a roll-and-move type game similar to Candy Land, and a game where each player wants to be the first to complete their building using various shapes.  This game is aimed at player ages 4 and up.

Contents:
1 double-sided game board
1 colored die
1 shape die
4 animal game pieces
18 picture cards
12 color shapes
Instructions

Name: Plotto
Description:
Plotto is a twist on 4-in-a-row played on a Hex board with four colors of stones.   The goal of the game is to place two stones of the same color such that they form the ends of a line of four.  The rules require that no two stones of the same color are adjacent.  In a two-player game, each player controls two colors.

Online Play

      gamerz.net (play by email)

Name: Peregrinatio: Pilgrimage to the Unknown
Description:
Peregrinatio - Pilgrimage to the unknown is set in the dark ages when the Celtic Saints left Ireland and traveled across the north of Britain going wherever God would lead them.

This game recreates the two themes of wandering and the tension of the pilgrims life - balancing nature, spirit and influencing the political powers.

The unique mechanic in this game is a 'trinity' board. This board shows graphically the focus of a player at any particular time.  If you need to have control of your pilgrims movement you need to be near the 'Nature' point, to receive blessings, by way of prayer tokens, you need to move towards the 'Spirit' and to win you need to influence the cities by being near the 'power'.

With good use of the trinity board, and some tactical wanderings you may manage to influence the majority of the cities and win the game.

Name: Fields of Glory: Napoleonic Scenarios for Shako Rules
Description:
Fields of Glory presents 18 scenarios for Shako's Napoleonic rules.
These battles are:
Castiglione, 1796
Rivoli, 1797
Bagration´s Battle, Austerlitz, 1805
The Russian Guard, Austerlitz, 1805
Halle, 1806
Medina de Río Seco, 1808
Vimiero, 1808
Medellín, 1809
Raab, 1809
Raszyn, 1809
Albuera, 1811
The Grand Redoubt, Borodino, 1812
Utitsa, Borodino, 1812
Liebertwolkwitz, 1813
Montmiriail, 1814
Plancenoit, Waterloo,1815
Wavre, 1815
With every scenario, the troops, the distribution of them among a diagram and the victory conditions are displayed. 
Also included are some rules clarifications and changes from the original rulebook.

These scenarios work with:

    Shako: Rules and Army Lists for Napoleonic Wargaming

Name: Reveal
Description: Reveal is a jumping strategy game for two players. The 6x6 gameboard and 24 two-sided playing pieces are used in an Othello-reminding but quite different game idea. You win the game when only your color shows on the board, even if your turn has not ended and if neutral pieces remain. This game is available on its own and also playable with Kadon's Six-by-Six game system set.

Name: Pseudo-Coup
Description: Pseudo-Coup is another Sudoku-based game. Probably the most beautiful one made. The acrylic nine by nine grid includes laser-cut pieces in nine colors. This allows standard Sudoku to be played with colors instead of numbers (much more pleasing to the eye), and also includes rules for games with up to nine players based on square grids, triangular grids, and more.

Name: Hmm...
Description: Hmm... is a positional strategy game from Kadon. On a turn, players can move pieces in directions the start facing or to adjacent spaces., and the goal is to get 4-in-line first. The game is somewhat similar to Gipf though not as advanced. It is available on its own or playable with Kadon's Six-by-Six game set.

Name: Nils Holgerssons wunderbare Reise
Description:
Accompany Nils in its fascinating travel game as you go from one adventure to the another on the game board. Good fortune with the dice along with the benefit of event cards can help you in your attempt to earn a greater number of adventure cards. Those cards will carry you nearer to victory, but you alone must decide which road to follow. Danger appears in the form of the Smirre Vixen who hinders your travel plans.

A game based on the Swedish Nobel Prize winner Selma Lagerlöf's (1858-1940) novel "The wonderful adventures of Nils" (sw. 1906-07, ger. 1907/1908, eng. 1910).

Name: Principles of War: Renaissance – Wars Between 1490 and 1660
Description:
The period starts in 1496 with the French invasion of Italy and ends in 1660 prior to the wars of Louis XIV.

The beginning of the period saw the pike as the main weapon to enable a foot soldier to stand against mounted opponents. The pike was used throughout the period supported by or supporting an increasing number of shot troops, only falling into disuse when the introduction of the bayonet merged the fire and shock capability of the infantry into one man. This period saw  the development of the gunpowder weapons from simple handguns and bombards of the middle ages to the mobile cannon and muskets that ruled the battlefield until the 19th century.

Like all the Principles of War rules, these rules have a simple mechanism with the emphasis on leaders' command and control. This is to represent the problems of commanding troops in battle which confronted kings, princes and mercenary leaders., rather than how many casualties each unit was taking at each stage of the battle. Major European conflicts ( including the English Civil war and Thirty Years war) covered in the 64 army lists. Now includes armies for Asia including Japan and Korea.
Families: Series: Principles of War – Miniature Wargame Rules (Tom Penn)

Name: Modern Micro Armour: The Game
Description:
Micro Armour: The Game - Modern provides players with rules for tanks, transport vehicles, aircraft (including helicopters), infantry, guided weapons -- in fact, every aspect of tactical combat developed over the last hundred years! Included are 50 pages of weapons & aircraft data, a scenario generator, tutorial and full color graphics for artillery impacts, minefields, smokescreens, napalm, wrecked vehicles and more.

As a bonus, 10 ready-to-play scenarios are included. The rules are concise, easy to learn and fun to play.

The game includes vehicle and equipment data for the following countries:

    Afghanistan
    Algeria
    Angola
    Argentina
    Australia
    Bosnia
    Canada
    Chad
    China (Peoples' Republic of)
    China/Taiwan (Republic of)
    Cuba
    Egypt
    France
    Germany
    India
    Iran
    Iraq
    Israel
    Jordan
    Korea (North)
    Korea (South)
    Korean War Allies
    Lebanon
    Libya
    Mexico
    Morocco
    Pakistan
    Persian Gulf States
    Russia/USSR/Chechnya
    South Africa
    Spain
    Syria
    United Kingdom
    United States
    the United Nations
    Vietnam
    Yugoslavia
    plus the 2003 Gulf War & 2003 Iraq


The publisher's goal is to provide the gamer with the tools needed to create the most satisfying game experience. To this end they have compiled an extensive online collection of country histories and TO&Es to download FREE. Use these with the guidelines in Micro Armour:The Game - Modern to customize modern wargaming.

There is also a free download version "Modern Micro Armour:The Tanks" using tanks only.

Expanded by:

    Modern Micro Armour: The Game - The Vietnam War Supplement  (TO&E, 2 Riverine scnarios where 1 model = 1 boat, and 12 normal scenarios) 


Re-Implements / Uses the same rules as:

    WWII Micro Armour

Name: Monopoly: My NHL
Description:
Introducing the first ever MONOPOLY game that YOU customize! Choose 22 of the 30 NHL teams and place your favorite team labels on the game board in the order you choose. Which teams will you choose? Which team will you put on Boardwalk? Park Place? Baltic? It’s your say, which teams play! So, set it up your way. Then. . . buy, sell and trade your favorite teams in an effort to own and control the NHL, every hockey fan’s fantasy. The team labels are removable and reusable so if you choose, you can play a different game each time. Features six oversized tokens including the Stanley Cup® trophy, goalie and puck.

Create it… Play it… Own it All… YOUR way! The NHL is yours for the taking!

Name: Loose Connections
Description: Loose Connections is billed as "The Game Where One Good Word Deserves Another."  Players are given three words related to a fourth word which they must discern -- somewhat similar to Tribond.  Players have a choice of 3 category levels -- easy, medium and difficult -- and can move on 3 different tracks -- long, medium and short -- to move on the board.  The game has 500 cards for a total of 1,500 Loose Connections questions.

Name: Klondike: Trivia Game on the Yukon
Description:
Klondike is a trivia game that allows players to re-experience the gold rush by traveling from Seattle to Dawson City.  On route players can move on if they obtain courage points and dollars.  These are gained by answering questions on the Klondike cards, by picking Event cards, or by playing poker (betting).

The game box and board include historic photos from the National Archives of Canada.

Contents.

Game board
Courage point bills
Paper money
A debt record
Event Cards
A box of Klondike cards
6 Markers
1 Die
A Set of rules.

Name: Marjapussi
Description:
Marjapussi (Berry bag) is a marriage-style trick-taking card game which is played with a deck containing cards from 6 to ace. It can be played by three individuals or by four players in two parties. The name of the game probably originates from the word marriage - not because it means the same thing but because it sounds similar.

The goal of the game is to reach exactly 12 points, although other kinds of scoring methods exist. Points are not awarded directly from tricks, but from making trumps, marriages, getting the last trick and getting the most 10s and aces among the tricks you've collected.

It is said that this is the national card game of Finland, although this may be an unofficial title.

Name: Werewolf's Castle
Description:
Werewolf's Castle is an unique combination adventure and mystery game for 2-12 players where each player moves his or her werewolf(ves) around a castle, seeking clues, facing betrayal, and trying to outwit his opponents.

As players move about the castle, they encounters monsters which they must fight, and gain items.  Items can help them to fight, recover, trap other players, or to test other players for proof that they are, or are not the killer.

When the possibilities narrow, and players think they know the killer's identity, they race to the main hall to denounce their suspect.  The first player to name the killer wins the game.

Name: Foodie Craze
Description:
The game is simply a collection of 400 multiple-choice trivia questions about food.  The questions are in ten different food-related categories, such as "American Classics", "Pot Luck", and "Extreme Cuisine".

The rules suggest several different ways to play the game and score, including a round-robin, every-person-for-themselves game; a couple team variants; a solitaire version; and a category-based version not unlike Trivial Pursuit.

Name: Pecos Bill
Description:
Pecos Bill is a card game played with a slightly customized deck of cards, although it could be played with a standard deck too. However, special deck helps players to remember various things - e.g. which cards are valuable.

Playing the game is very similar to Casino. Players try to capture cards from the board with their hand cards by a similar mechanic.

There are many ways to score points. E.g. when player manages to clear a table, he's awarded with a Pecos, which equals one point at the end of the round. Getting a Pecos Bill card and all four flags is worth 50 points.

The game is played over multiple rounds. At the end of each round, players receive points according to the cards they managed to get. The player who first reaches exactly 301 points is the winner. Going over is penalized.

There's no signs that the game is published outside Finland.

Name: Der Goldene Schuss
Description:
A German game based on one the most popular game shows on German television in the 1960s of the same title. The game includes a board, two plastic crossbows, pawns, dice, three plastic balls and a plastic figurine, as well as a cardboard with holes in it. Apparently, the player moves along the board by rolling dice. If he lands on a field with an apple or bulls-eye he has to shoot an arrow through the appropriate hole on the cardboard component. The player that reaches the bulls-eye in the center of the board first, wins.

(game number assigned by Noris: 626/2450)

Name: Die Leute von der Shiloh-Ranch
Description:
A game for 2-4 players, a tie-in to the TV series "The Virginian", called "Die Leute von der Shiloh-Ranch" in Germany. Suitable for children 5 years and older. Each player has three pawns and three judges (Garth, Virginian and Betsy) meeples (wooden sticks with the letters G, V, and B imprinted respectively). The objective of the game is to reach the cowboys located in the middle of the game board. 
(game number assigned by Schmidt: 601 1097)
(name of publisher on box: Schmidt Spiel + Freizeit GmbH)

Name: Fury
Description:
An old German game from 1961, probably a tie-in to the TV series "Fury" which ran in Germany from 1958 onwards. Up to 4 players move along a string of numbers (87 in total) on the board by rolling a die, 13 fields have special meanings (actions to be taken described in the rulebook), influencing movement positively or negatively. 
(game number assigned by Noris Spiele: 204)

Name: Warum nicht?
Description: A German question & answer game. (Assigned game number from Spear Spiele: 16352 or 96352)

Name: Sew You Want To Be A Quilter
Description:
The game is comprised of a Game Board, eight colored "Spools of Thread" (which are the game playing pieces), a single die (to control game flow), 3,000 quilting and sewing trivia "Question / Answer Cards" (6 questions and answers per card with a total of 500 cards, click on the Sample Questions spool to the left for an example, there are 1,000 questions and they change daily, 3 new questions per day so come back each day and test your knowledge), and 200 "Perk" and "Quirk" cards which bestow benefits or penalties respectively.

The goal of the game is to visit each of the four quilt stores located on the game board (Barnyard Quilts, Heavenly Quiltworks, Windmill Quilts and Riverview Quilts), as well as an additional number of locations decided upon by the game players.  The duration of the game can be lengthened or shortened depending on the total number of locations that the players decide must be visited, however, at a minimum the players must visit all four of the quilt stores to win the game.

Home Page: http://www.sewyouwanttobeaquilter.com

Name: Napoleon in Sunset, 1814
Description:
Original game published in Command Magazine Japan #52 in 2003, together with Dynamo: Dunkirk, 1940.
Designed by Shigeru Hirano.

Name: Conquest of Shinshu
Description:
This game reproduces Takeda Shingen's campaign to control Shinshu province (1542-1553) using a "card-driven system". Each player fights as the Takeda side and the anti-Takeda forces. The main anti-Takeda lords are Yoshikiyo Murakami, Nagatoki Ogasawara, and Kenshin Uesugi.

Contents:

    A3 map size
    80 counters
    8 pages Rule booklet
    36 cards


(adapted from publisher's description)


Note: ä¿¡å·ž Shinshu åˆ¶åœ§ Conquest
Shinano (ä¿¡æ¿ƒå›½) or ShinshÅ« (ä¿¡å·ž) Province https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinano_Province

Name: 河井継之助 最後の賭け (Tsuginosuke Kawai's Last Gamble)
Description:
Original game published in Command Magazine Japan #61 in 2005, as a companion to Hougoumont: Rock of Waterloo. Designed as a mini-game, it details the Battle of Hokuetsu in 1867 (Bakumatsu era) between the shogunate forces and the imperial forces in Niigata prefecture.

The game uses point to point map and chit activation mechanics.
This is the fourth game of 60 series, which can be played with only 60 counters and in 60 minutes.

The victory is determined by victory points, which are gained by important locations control. The Aizu alliance wins if it scores 1 VP; the Meiji government army wins if it earns 5 VP. All other results are a draw.

Contents:

        1 map
        60 counters
        4 pages rulebook




æ²³äº•ç¶™ä¹‹åŠ© (Tsuginosuke Kawai) was a Samurai:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawai_Tsugunosukeæœ€å¾Œã®è³­ã‘: last gamble
Families: History: Boshin War & Meiji Era Rebellions

Name: True Record of Nobunaga
Description:
Oda Nobunaga continues to take administrative reform one after another in order to put an end to the civil war. On the other hand, Shogun Yoshiaki dreaming of the rebirth of the Ashikaga shogunate's power, planned the mobilization of anti-Nobunaga forces. Nobunaga was hit by a surprise attack led by Asai Nagamasa but succeeded in escaping to Kyoto. In 1570

True Record of Nobunaga is a simulation game that reproduces the conflict between Nobunaga Oda and the anti-Oda forces.  
It is a revised version of "Nobunaga Kenji" which was published in the second issue of Double Charge magazine.


First edition: supplement of Japanese Wargame Magazine Double Charge #2.
Second edition republished in Command Magazine Japan #69 in 2006 (along with Hideyoshi's Greatest Defeat).

Second edition components:

    A2 format map
    70 counters
    8 page rulebook

Name: Hideyoshi's Greatest Defeat
Description:
Hideyoshi's Greatest Defeat details Toyotomi Hideyoshi's invasion of Korea in 1592.

Components:

    A2 format map
    70 counters
    8 page rulebook


Published in Command Magazine Japan #69 in 2006 (along with True Record of Nobunaga).

Name: Masakado chronicle
Description:
The game was published in Command Magazine Japan Basic #1.

The samurai Taira no Masakado (å¹³å°†é–€) rebelled in 939 against central government of Kyoto. His life is detailed in the ShÅmonki (å°†é–€è¨˜).
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taira_no_Masakado
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tengy%C5%8D_no_Ran
Families: History: Conflicts of the Heian period – Japan

Name: Rush on Berlin
Description: Original game published in Command Magazine Japan #39 in 2001.

Name: Shingen's Last Fight
Description:
This game is a redesign version of ä¿¡çŽ„ä¸Šæ´› (Shingen Joraku) (1986) with rerated leaders.

This game was published in Command Magazine Japan #36 in 2001.

Name: Battle for Mukden
Description: Original game by Masahiro Yamazaki published in Command Magazine Japan #16 in 1997.

Name: Piraci
Description:
A short cardgame from Udo Peise, released in Poland by Trefl.
Overtake the other treasure hunters!
The players offer around a laid out card. Who reacts thereby fastest and most skillful, receives the card and takes points for it. This succeeds best "with heart". Sometimes however the Pirate is near and takes the treasures.
The player with most points of treasure wins.

Name: Federation & Empire: Strategic Operations
Description:
From the publishers site - WE need a whole new Strategy

And now you have it! Hospital ships to un-devastated planets. Sector bases to bolster defenses. Operational bases to move the fight toward the enemy. Small transports to move around small things (money, people, etc.). Dozens of new ship types. Engineers to build defenses. Survey ships to find money. Diplomat that make deals that could delay war or just make money!

And give it all a spin in the new scenario MAELSTROM!

Three sheets of double-sided counters, plus rulebook.

Name: Plopp!
Description:
The game consists of 4 suction-cups-on-a-stick (German: poempel), 5 cardboard chits with 5 different faces, 25 cards representing the 5 different faces (5 each), and 13 pieces sponges (wooden blocks).

Each player get a 'poempel', the cards are shuffled and divided among all players. The chits are laid out visibly in the middle of the board and the sponges are set aside.

Using only one hand all players start revealing cards from their stack simultaneously. If two or more players reveal the same face they try to grab their poempel and 'suck-up' the right cardboard chit.
The one to get the chit first, earns one sponge. The game then resumes. If you grab a chit erroneously you have to give back a sponge. The game ends when all sponges are distributed. The player with the most sponges wins.

Name: Hossa! Weihnachts-Special
Description:
Special expansion for base game of Hossa. The theme of this game is Christmas.
4 double printed cards: 

     # 121 = trösten, Trost /  comfort, solace & froh, fröhlich / happy, merry
     # 122 = Hirte / shepherd & Sohn, Jesus, Christus / son, Jesus, Christ
     # 123 = loben, bitten, preisen / praise, pray, laud & Heil, heilig / salvation, holy, sacred
     # 124 = Segen, Gnade / blessing, grace, mercy

Name: IJN: Imperial Japanese Navy, 1941-45
Description:
Tactical naval battles in the Pacific. Includes fleets of Japan, US, UK and the Netherlands.

12 scenarios.
400 counters.

Name: Top Cat
Description:
Whitman #4806. The game board is changed by rotating the wheel inside the game board (and spaces on the board are indicated by color).  Referenced and pictured in Malloy's American Games : Comprehensive Collector's Guide

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

A matter of interest.....
In Britain, Top Cat was a leading name in the business of selling cat food for a pet. So the BBC changed the name to Boss Cat. However they did not change the words in the intro song. Thus The song sang "Top Cat" whilst the name on the credits said "Boss Cat".

Name: Trap-Em!
Description:
Trap-Em - The African Safari Game.  Listed and pictured in Malloy's American Games: A Comprehensive Collector's Guide

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

Game where players are professional hunters, trying to make money hunting animals. 
Earn more money to take them alive for zoos, dead give less money.
Hunters receive cablegrams from museums and zoos make attactive money offers.
Components: 
Twenty wild african animals,board,12 cablegrams,4 plastic hunters,money and roulette for movement.

Name: Crucible of Courage
Description:
Crucible of Courage introduces Richard Berg’s long-awaited Civil War Tactical System, The Rifled-Musket Game System

Crucible of Courage emphasizes the limits of command, training, and discipline, all in the light of what soldiers will do despite what their leaders want. Yes, all the weapons are present, including artillery, but the fun is in getting your men to use them in the most effective way. See why most Civil War combat was close-range firefights … or maybe you can find a way to change that!

Crucible of Courage includes five scenarios, all historical battles with their own maps and counters for the actual units, each a different view on the tactical details of the American Civil War.

Crucible of Courage scenarios:

1st Manassas (Virginia, July 21, 1861, the opening moments of the battle, Burnside’s 2nd RI vs The Louisiana Tigers) 
Athens (Missouri, August 5, 1861, local militia, street-fighting, and hollowed logs as cannon) 
James Island (SC, June 3, 1862, the Union’s initial attempt to attack Charleston by land) 
Chickamauga (Georgia, September 18, 1862; Wilder's Brigade, armed with repeateres, holds the bridge against two brigades from Lidell's Division. 
James Island, (SC, July 16 1863, the 54th Massachusetts Colored Regiment gets its baptism under fire

Crucible of Courage is designed for quick learning and easy play, a system that has almost unlimited possibilities. Game rules are short, but there are lots of charts and tables to cover every aspect of battle at this micro level. Playing time is 2-4 hours for any scenario.

Name: Starfire: Sky Marshal #1
Description: Module for Starfire (3rd Edition) covering all aspects of the Starfire Universe. It contained scenarios, fiction, and clarifications of rules and ship design and strategy.

Name: Battle of Leyte Gulf
Description:
Mini-game.

Comprises 4 scenarios of the different phases of the battle:
1) Entrance of Leyte
2) San Bernardino Strait
3) The Chase
4) Surigao Strait

110 Counters.

Name: Schöne weite Welt
Description:
There are six boards showing the 6 continents (Australia also shows Indonesia and Papua New Guinea). The boards show the maps of the areas. With each boards comes a set of tiles that can be placed on to the map to form a grip. These tiles show a nice drawn version of the map in front (with some scenes and tourist attractions of the area) and on the back there is a reference to cities or other landmarks corresponding to the tiles place on the board. 
Each player now gets a board and tiles, shuffle the tiles and start to be the first to complete the grid. If you do this by the front side (puzzling) or by the backside (looking for the places and using the front only to see where its correct) is up to you. Player finishing first wins. Of course, everybody should play with every continent.
And of course, quite a lot of the countries have changed since this game was published.

Name: Sailors Knot
Description: Its basically "Shut the box" but in addition you have to tie the knot thats corresponding to the number rolled. If you fail to do so in the time limit you are also busted.

Name: Axiom
Description:
In Axiom players compete in the art of knowing dictum and slogans. It can be played with two players to a maximum of six teams consisting of many players.

The idea of the game is simple. You're being asked a question. If you know it you can progress three steps forward on the score board. If you know it after you've given a set of choices, you only take one step forward.

The first player who reaches the end of the score track wins.

Name: Emergency Ward 10
Description: Game based on a hit T.V. series on English television in the 1960's called  Emergency Ward 10. One of, if not the first of the television hospital soap type series. The game includes four counters, four vehicles, a spinner and playing instruction leaflet. You move around a circular board beginning on the outside rim and finishing on the inside rim. The spinners move number determines what happens to you on this recreation of the show.

Name: Triumph of the Will: Wargames Rules for Revolutionary Warfare 1914 to 1936
Description:
Miniature Wargame rules for revolutionary warfare 1914 to 1936
Concentrating on the revolutionary warfare of the Spartakist Revolution, and the Russian and Spanish Civil Wars, these rules emphasize the importance of willpower amongst your troops. Small numbers of highly motivated troops will outperform hordes of disinterested conscripts in these vicious and unforgiving conflicts.
Armored trains, the International Brigades, desperate men fighting for their version of the truth are all here in rules that capture the very crusading essence of these political conflicts.

Name: Funny Things Happen
Description:
A pretty simple board game, the object of which is to leave your home and get to work by taking advantage of good squares and avoiding bad hazard squares. The game box features some very nice seaside postcard style illustrations on both the box and the game board.

Looks like it could be a variant on Chutes and Ladders

Name: If the Lord Spares Us: Wargame Rules for the First World War in the Middle East
Description:
Miniature Wargame rules for the First World War in the Middle East.

“…Til we meet again, if the Lord Spares Us”. So ends the last letter written home from Gallipoli veteran 202537 Lance Sergeant Albert Skinner, 2/4th Royal West Kent Regiment, just a few weeks before his death in the hills near Tel Khuweilfe, a few miles north east of Beersheba, Palestine on 4th  November 1917. These rules are dedicated to Albert and all those other poor sods who are still out there.

It's a long way to Tipperary but whether you're fighting your way up Anzac Cove, sipping Pimms as part of Townshend's Regatta up the Tigris, marching through Jerusalem with Allenby, or bouncing on a flea-ridden camel on the route to Damascus with Lawrence of Arabia these rules will enable you to pack up your troubles and take the fight to Johnny Turk. Away from the quagmire of the Western Front ITLSU proves that brigade level games the Great War in the Middle East have components of everything; camels, arab war bands, sweeping cavalry attacks, opposed beach landings, massed machine guns, gas attacks, tanks, armored cars, fighting in the mirage, water shortages, trench assaults, river gunboats - and enough command and control dilemmas to test the most cunning Pasha.The opportunities it provides are boundless. ITLSU makes every wargame a Great War game!

Name: Great Battles of World War Two: Volume 3 – Invasion '40
Description: Bruce McFarlane's 8th miniatures guide-book covering large battles.  The third in the Great Battles of World War Two Series.  Each stand represents a company with maneuver elements being battalions.  The scale and scope of the game allows multi-divisional actions simulating many days - not minutes.  French, Dutch, Belgian and German 1940 History, Organization, Weapons and Tactics.  Six scenarios including Fortress Holland, Eben Emael, Dinant, Sedan and Arras.

Name: Algernon Pulls it Off
Description: Miniature wargame rules for Great War air combat.  These rules are a development of the Too Fat Lardies Second World War air combat rules Bag the Hun.

Name: Charlie Company: Infantry Combat in Vietnam, 1965-1972
Description:
Miniature wargame rules for Infantry Action in Vietnam 1965 - 1968.
Charlie Company is designed to serve as an ongoing miniatures campaign game which reflects those peculiar circumstances that were a part of Infantry Combat in Vietnam.  As such the rules are designed to focus on the Infantry Company and its supporting arms, and not on Special Forces, Riverine or Armored Cavalry actions.  As a game system it can be played with anywhere from 3 players to as many as 20, with one person serving as umpire and being responsible for setting up and running the game.

Players take the role of a Company Commander, Lieutenant, or Sergeant in the US armed forces; the GM controls the VC and NVA. The players start off green and continue their “Tour of Duty” through scenarios and gain experience. Eventually, if they are lucky and skillful, they will become seasoned veterans. The game expects the players to complete 12 of these missions before their tour of duty has ended.

The book provides an overview of the Vietnam War and how the various militaries were comprised. Players may play Marines or the US Army and each is historically equipped. South Vietnamese units may be used as auxiliary forces as well as Ruff Puff’s, the CIDG, the Australians, the Koreans, and American engineers/special forces/LRRP teams. Terrain includes open, brush, elephant grass, forest, dense forest, jungle, rubber plantations, rivers and streams, swamp, villages, urban combat, bunkers and entrenchments, tunnels, rice paddies, hills, gullies, canals, roads, trails, and paths. Rules for booby traps like pungi stakes, claymores, etc. are also given. Helicopter assaults and air support rules (fire for effect, napalm, strafing, are in addition to all the typical infantry maneuvers usually found in miniatures wargames like direct fire, charging, grenades, sniping, forward observers, indirect fire, artillery, etc. Also includes rules for night vision, sappers, flamethrowers, engineers, riverine operations, beehive rounds, and prisoners. There is also a glossary of military jargon and a bibliography of suggested books to give Game Masters ideas for more scenarios.

Name: Bodycount: Wargames Rules for the Vietnam War
Description:
Miniature wargame rules for the Vietnam War.  Bodycount is for 2-6 players plus an umpire.  The umpire controls the VC and NVA forces and these are not deployed on the table until spotted.

Expanded by:

    The Face of Battle: The Hill Battles â€“ Khe Sanh, Vietnam: 1967

Name: Buckle For Your Dust! Wargaming in Miniature: Vietnam 1965-1973
Description: Buckle For Your Dust! is a set of explanations, rules and scenario data for small unit actions (at platoon or squad level) set in the 'American' war in Vietnam.  It is designed to be used with miniatures, vehicles and terrain in any scale although scales such as HO/OO, 1/72 or 20mm / 15mm are recommended.  Larger scenarios may be played with scales around 1/300 or 5mm.

Name: Blondie Hurry Scurry Game
Description:
In this 1966 Transogram game - Blondie, The Hurry Scurry Game which is based on the long running Blondie cartoon strip.  Blondie and Dagwood figures dance their way around the board following Arthur Murray style dance pattern footprints.
Game comes with a spinner and cardboard figures of the characters. Game has both English and French translations of the rules.

Name: Stingray
Description: Sting Ray by Transogram. The object of the game is to move through the underwater maze using spin and move. Little cardboard pieces are used to signify where you are in the maze. Tie breaker pieces are used to determine who gets to move to a particular spot.

Name: Magilla Gorilla
Description:
This is a spin and move game based on the 1964 cartoon  show of the same name. In Magilla Gorilla, the protagonist spent his time languishing in the front display window of Mr. Peebles' pet shop, eating bananas and being a drain on the businessman's finances. Mr. Peebles marked down Magilla's price considerably, but Magilla was invariably only purchased for a short time, typically by some thieves who needed a gorilla to break into a bank or by an advertising company looking for a mascot for their new product. The customers always ended up returning Magilla, forcing Mr. Peebles to return their money. Magilla ended each episode with his catchphrase, "We'll try again next week."

The object of the game is to acquire Parrots, Cats and Monkeys which help to get you to the finish line instead of being returned to Mr. Peeples.

Name: Kentucky Jones
Description: This game is based on a television show from the period which starred Dennis Weaver (Chester of Gunsmoke fame). It is a spin the spinner and move game.

Name: Tongue Tanglers
Description:
Tongue Tanglers™ is a hilarious tongue-twister party game for up to 10 players. We don’t give you tongue-twisters to say - you create them for the your opponents from a set of cards.

Simple to play but tough to say, each player draws a card and places it into any position on any other player’s word pad. That player must now say their new tongue-twister as many times as they can in 10 seconds. Each successful read scores a point, but any mistake (and they’re usually funny!) ends the turn. So read slowly, or read fast, one mistake will be your last!

Tongue Tanglers includes card tray, 10 word pads, scoring markers, timer, instructions, and cards containing over 900 words specially selected for hours of hilarious party fun. 2-10 players, ages 8 to adult.

Name: Grand Prix
Description: Game comes with two tracks.  Each player uses a steering wheel to 'drive' their cars around the track. The steering wheel operates a magnet on the underside of the track for guiding racing cars around the circuit. The game includes four cars, two for each player. There are a number of track side obstacles including hedges, walls, fences, bridges, tunnels, bridge walls. First player to complete the circuit is the winner.

Name: Black Powder Battles
Description: Miniature wargame rules for the Black Powder weapons era including the French and Indian War, American War of Independence and Napoleonic Wars.  These are skirmish rules based on 2 Hour Wargames Chain Reaction 2.0 system.

Name: La Mer
Description: Game about sea life. French author of the game Alain Bombard, worked as an oceanographic specialist in Monaco and did many expeditions including documentaries with Jacques Cousteau. This game is based upon his expeditions and tries to make people clear that the sea covers 71% of the earth and that it's health is important to us. The game has 25 cards and 4 pawns. It's a hard to find collectors game that covers  fauna, flora, navigation and secrets of the sea.

Name: Montjoie!
Description: Miniature wargame rules for Medieval skirmishes.  The rules are developed from but different to the 2 Hour Wargames Chain Reaction 2.0 system.  The rules include army lists for the major Medieval wars and both a campaign system and siege rules.

Name: Reise ins Tierreich
Description: Travel around the world over the 5 continents and discover about the exotic animals living in the places that U pass through. The game was developed by animal professor Heinz Sielmann. It contains a board with the world on it, 4 pawns, 4 dice (with the nr. 6 replaced by a color, 60 animal cards and 40 chips.

Name: Food Fight
Description:
Chuck ducked under the flying burger as he made his way to his seat. The Jocks were at it again, he said to himself, sitting down next to the other geeks. Just then a milk shake flew overhead and exploded high over the Preppie's table. With a howl the Cheerleader leaped up and started screaming about how hard it was to get chocolate out of cashmere. Then it begun, the food started to fly between the tables, Jocks throwing chips and cola cans while the Preppies laid in with hot dogs and yogurt cups. Soon the whole cafeteria as a mess of flying food and gangs of students dodging and thrown their lunch.

Chuck sat lower in his chair, trying to avoid being hit and continued to eat his PB&J. That's when the bagel hit the fan, and he was hit with a cup of soap. Now it was war Chuck said to himself as he gathered up food of his own to throw.

This is food Fight, a fun, fast game of insanity. Can your team of teenagers out fight their dreaded and hated foes as the food flies and the fun begins.

One of Bad Baby's many Mini-game, Food Fight will allow you to make a mess and still have fun.

Name: Conjurer
Description:
Julia watched as her foe summoned a Hydra with a flourish and a puff of green smoke. Jarrird had always been a bit of a show off Julia thought as she watched the many-headed beast slither about on the ground before its new master.

No matter she smiled, her enemy could be as showy as he wanted to be, it would not stop her from crushing him under her boot heel. Knowing the Hydra would still be a bit dazed from its master's summoning spell, and thus vulnerable, Julia quickly sent her Goblins in to kill it. The small green warriors each drew their short sword and rushed the larger creature, each yelling a shrill battle cry as they charged. Julia knew the little green Goblins would have no chance against the many heads of the Hydra, but she hoped to at least hurt it a little bit so her Minotaur could finish the job. Once his last defender had been taken care of, well Jarrird would be next.

This is Conjurer, a new Mini-game from Bad Baby Productions. Play a skilled wizard as they battle other spell casters in a duel of summoning. Each magician has the skill to summon various monsters to their aid, monsters they then may send into battle in a desperate attempt to kill their foe before they themselves are dragged down. Skill, cunning and a little bit of luck is need to be a successful conjurer and thus master over all those that would stand against you.

Name: Space Armada
Description:
Ensign Jones grabbed a handrail as the federation missile slammed into the aft hull of the ship. The explosion rocked the ship he and the others were encased in, shacking it like some small child playing with a toy.

"Damn", he thought as he pulled himself along the passage tube, "Another hit like that and we might not survive this engagement." With the gravity turned off for battle stations, Jones found it hard to reach his station. Still he managed to make his way down the tube towards the beam weapon's controls. The captain wanted to make a quick pass on the federation carrier before it could launch all of its fighters. Jones thought it was a suicidal run at best, but the captain had been lucky so far and she might just pull it off, might Jones thought as the next missile hit home?

This is Space Armada, the newest Mini-game from Bad Baby Productions. Across our solar system, in the distant future, battle two mighty space fleets. The imperialistic Federation means to bring the whole of system under their sway. Meanwhile the Colonial Fleets, each a small, independent fleet in its own right have banded together to stop this move by the Federation. The fate of the human race now lies in your hands as you command one of those fleets. Will the Federation bring order and law to the solar system, or will the independent colonies and mining outposts remain free.

Space Armada is a fast past game of space fleet battles, wages across the solar system. Players will need to be decisive in their game play, all the while trying to protect their fleet's ships, waiting for the right moment to strike.

Name: Stock Block
Description:
Stock Block - "The Original, Individualized Game for Any City"
[from the rules]

The idea of the game Stock Block is to purchase, trade and sell various stock certificates and stock shares (relating to historical, significant and economic landmarks in particular cities) in an effort to "crash" and "29" your opponents. Each player shrewdly conducts his "board business" in an effort to force other players into liquidating their stock shares and crash certificates when they do not have enough cash to pay the interest charges on their stock certificate squares.

Stock Block games now available for: Albuquerque, Atlanta, Baltimore, Charlotte, Chicago, Cincinnati, Cleveland, Columbus, Dallas, Dayton, Denver, Detroit, Fort Worth, Houston, Indianapolis, Los Angeles, Lexington, Louisville, Memphis, Milwaukee, Nevada, New York, Oklahoma City, Philadelphia, Phoenix, Portland, Richmond, Salt Lake City, San Diego, San Francisco, Seattle, Spokane, Twin Cities, U.S.A., Washington D.C., Montreal, Ottawa, Quebec, Toronto, Winnipeg, Vancouver, Barbados, Bermuda, Caribbean and Oxford.

Packaging, construction and distinctive game design are trademarks of J.F.M. Games Company's Stock Exchange Board Game, Registered in the US. Patent Office, Great Britain, Canada and Japan. Marca Registrada. Copyright 1976, 1977, 1978, 1979, 1980 by John F. Majors.

Name: Pingo Pongo
Description: Each player gets dealt a hand of Pingo cards, Pongo cards and Pingo-Pongo cards.  If your opponent plays a Pingo card, you must play a Pongo card.  It's back and forth fun for everyone.  Play a Pingo-Pongo card and win the pile.  Whoever wins the most cards, wins the game.

Name: Dennis the Menace
Description: This game from Standard Toycraft represents the Original TV show by this name. The TV show starred Jay North as Dennis, with first Joseph Kearns, who died in 1962 and then Gale Gordon as Mr. Wilson. The object of the game is catch Dennis as he moves around the neighborhood. Players take the part of Dennis' friends Margaret and Tommy and his mom and dad Henry and Alice in this roll and move effort to catch Dennis.

Name: Bastards Inc.
Description:
Ba$tard$ Inc. is a satirical boardgame for 2-6 players. Each player controls an international mega corporation and tries to manipulate politics, the economy, and the media for profit. You can even start wars to earn money, but be careful as things can get out of hand...

Some features of the game:

- Corporations have different strengths and weaknesses, which their player must choose at the beginning of the game. This makes different strategies possible.

- Action cards allow the players to manipulate the game in various ways, damage their competitors, or earn money through shady deals.

Ba$tard$ Inc. is available online for free (see the link section) as a print-and-play kit. You also need to supply some components.

Name: Aussie Rules Super Earthling Abductor
Description: This game is based upon the players drawing a mission card, and attempting to complete this mission.  Players do not reveal their missions to the other players.  There are 3 different classes of ships to choose from.  Players can see what their opponents ships are, and narrow down the potential mission of their opponent.  As the game progresses, players attempt to block their opponents from reaching their goals.  The goal may be to abduct different types of earthlings, or destroying cities (to name a few).  On each city, there is a marker that the player flips to determine how many cards to pull, or perhaps damage to the ship.  An additional angle is not all of the cards drawn are not necessarily good, so, it may not always be advantageous to be on a city that is giving a lot of cards.

Name: Fussball Weltmeisterschaft 1974
Description: Soccer game released by an Italian publisher. Based upon the 1974 world cup. No dice.

Name: Sharivari
Description: In this French party game, which features illustrations by David Cochard, players are divided in 2 or more teams. The goal is to search a word that fits an imposed theme. The game is played without pencil & paper but does include 32 recto-verso cards, 2 rule cards and 40 chips.
